messages.message:
A few thoughts while using Build:
• An icon (or label) for which Model is being used for fields in Build would be helpful. 
• A multi-select ability to change many fields models all at once
• The dropdown for changing the model type isn’t very obvious, having a label on it would be helpful
• Also when creating a lot of fields at once having a “model” select option in that popup would be useful
• The upload progress tab at the bottom is kind of strange, can’t the files just show up in the file list and have an “uploading/loading” indicator
• Editing a field, running it, having to click “Save” at the bottom, _then_ having to click the breadcrumb “Classes” at the top to show all fields is a lot of clicking. And when doing this for many fields is not ideal.
    ◦ Move the “Save Fields” button (and even the run field button) to the top of the column
    ◦ Make a “Show all Fields” button or something, the breadcrumbs isn’t very clear
• Hotkeys would be pretty sweet
we don't have a concept of "which model is being used in a field" in 23.43?
oh i see what you mean, the extraction/reasoning dropdown
(which is not supposed to be a model dropdown—it doesn't actually change the model, only changes how we call it, i think)
its chat GPT 3.5 vs. 4 isn’t it?
Regardless, a multi-edit ability would be nice
@Travis no its all gpt 3.5. We’re adding a toggle in the project settings to switch between LLM models but that will be a project wide setting
the navigation is definitely something that could use work—i know @Serena has been thinking a lot about this
